intro: Pterocypsela formosana, commonly known as the Formosan pterocypsela, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a head-like structure typical of the daisy family. It is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
